text:
About Arlo (Process / Features / Compliance / Policy) 
EXTERNAL KB 
 
 What do I need to know about the Arlo Theft Replacement program? What do I need to know about the 
Arlo Theft Replacement program? The article about the Arlo Theft Replacement program applies to: AVD4001, AVD3001, AVD2001, AVD1001, AAD1001, AL1101, VMC5040, VMC4030P, VMC4040P, FB1001, VMC4041P, VMC4050P, VMC4060P, VMC4030, VMC2020, VMC2030, VMC2032, VMC3050, VMC2050, VMC3052, VMC2052, VMC3030, 1. What is the Arlo Theft Replacement program? The Arlo Theft Replacement (ATR) program allows the original purchasers of certain 
Arlo devices connected to paid Arlo subscription plans to qualify for replacements in 
the event that they are stolen.

What is an eligible Arlo device? An “Eligible Device” is an Arlo wire-free camera product (Arlo Wire-Free, Arlo 
Essential Outdoor Camera [2nd Generation], Arlo Essential XL Outdoor Camera [2nd 
Generation], Arlo Essential wire-free, Arlo Pro, Arlo Pro 2, Arlo Pro 3, Arlo Pro 3 
Floodlight, Arlo Pro 4, Arlo Pro 5S, Arlo Ultra, and Arlo Ultra 2), Arlo doorbell product 
(Arlo Video Doorbell [2nd Generation], Arlo Essential Video Doorbell Wired, Arlo 
Essential Video Doorbell Wire-Free, and Arlo Audio Doorbell), or Arlo wire-free light 
product (Arlo Security Light), and the product’s accompanying batteries (if 
applicable). The Eligible Device must have been purchased directly from an Arlo 
authorized reseller within the 12 months preceding the theft and may have been 
bought as brand new or certified refurbished. The Eligible Device must be registered

under an Arlo account by the original purchaser at the time of the theft and will be 
rendered inoperative when registered as stolen under the ATR program.
What must I do to request a replacement device under the ATR program?
A.

File a police report and request a copy of the report showing a case number 
and law enforcement contact within two weeks of the theft.

The registered 
owner of the Arlo account using the Eligible Device must be the person who 
files the police report.
B.

Do NOT remove the stolen Eligible Device from your Arlo account until you 
have contacted Arlo Support. C. Initiate an ATR claim by contacting Arlo Support within 30 days of the date 
printed on the police report. You will need to provide Arlo with your Eligible 
Device and account information, so that Arlo may validate and process your 
claim. You must have valid proof of purchase of the Eligible Device to initiate 
an ATR claim.

Your recordings and personal information are protected in the 
Arlo cloud, as long as your account credentials were not stolen.

D. Once we verify the police report and your ownership of the stolen Eligible 
Device and account, we will process the replacement. The replacement will 
be the same or similar make and model as the original Eligible Device and 
may be new or refurbished.

E. You must be on a paid Arlo subscription plan (Arlo Secure, Arlo Secure Plus, 
Arlo Safe & Secure Pro for Home; Advanced, Professional, or Enterprise for 
Business) at the time of the Eligible Device theft.

F. The theft must have occurred within the United States, Australia, or New 
Zealand, and the law enforcement contact on the police report must be in the 
United States, Australia, or New Zealand.

What is not covered under the ATR program? A. Arlo products purchased from unauthorized resellers including third party 
sellers on Amazon, eBay, and other marketplaces are not eligible for the ATR 
program.

B. Arlo Go, Arlo Go 2, Arlo SmartHubs, Arlo Base Stations, Arlo Bridges, and 
indoor cameras such as Arlo Q, Arlo Q Plus, Arlo Baby, Arlo Essential Indoor Camera, and Arlo Essential Indoor Camera (2nd Generation) are not eligible 
for the ATR program. C. Arlo accessories such as mounts, skins, cables, solar panels, or power 
adapters are not eligible for the ATR program. D. The ATR program does not apply to theft during or upon delivery of your Arlo 
Eligible Device, or to theft any time prior to the registering of the Eligible 
Device to your Arlo account. E. The ATR program is not transferable. Arlo Small Print: The ATR program is a courtesy service provided by Arlo. E. The ATR program is not transferable. Arlo will determine in its 
sole reasonable discretion whether a claim under the ATR program meets the eligibility criteria. Arlo’s decisions regarding eligibility and all other aspects of the ATR Program are final and binding. Arlo may, at any time in its sole discretion and without prior notice, terminate, cancel, or suspend the 
ATR Program; alter the requirements of the ATR Program; modify the administration of the ATR 
Program; or deny ATR claims because of Arlo’s reasonable business concerns, including without 
limitation for suspected fraud and repeated claims by the same person or account. DISCLAIMER AND LIMIT OF LIABILITY: OTHER THAN AS ABOVE, ARLO MAKES NO 
REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, REGARDING 
THE ATR PROGRAM. ARLO WILL NOT BE RESPONSIBLE OR LIABLE FOR ANY LOSS, 
DAMAGE, COST, OR INJURY THAT ARISES FROM OR RELATES TO PARTICIPATION IN THE 
ATR PROGRAM, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO: (I) LATE, LOST, DELAYED, DAMAGED, 
MISDIRECTED, INCOMPLETE, OR UNINTELLIGIBLE CLAIMS; (II) TELEPHONE, ELECTRONIC, 
HARDWARE, SOFTWARE, NETWORK, INTERNET, OR COMPUTER MALFUNCTIONS, 
FAILURES, OR VIRUSES; (III) FAILED, INCOMPLETE, GARBLED, OR DELAYED COMPUTER 
TRANSMISSIONS; (IV) THE USE OR DOWNLOADING OF ANY SOFTWARE OR MATERIAL IN 
CONNECTION WITH THIS ATR PROGRAM; (V) TYPOGRAPHICAL OR OTHER ERRORS IN THE 
PRINTING OF THE OFFER OR ADMINISTRATION OF THE ATR PROGRAM; AND (VI) ANY 
OTHER CONDITION THAT MAY CAUSE THE ATR PROGRAM TO BE DISRUPTED. RELEASE: TO THE EXTENT ALLOWED BY LAW, BY PARTICIPATING IN THE ATR PROGRAM, 
EACH ENTRANT RELEASES AND AGREES TO HOLD HARMLESS ARLO FROM ANY LIABILITY 
FOR ANY CLAIMS, COSTS, LOSSES, OR DAMAGES OF ANY KIND ARISING OUT OF OR IN 
CONNECTION WITH TO THE ATR PROGRAM.
The article about the Arlo Legacy Cameras End of Life was last updated on 09/11/2024.

Based on this analysis, we determine when our products and services need to be updated or retired 
and moved into their End of Life (EOL) stage. There are various factors considered when deciding to 
EOL a product or service, including data security, data privacy, product and service performance, 
functionality, utility, operational efficiency, and scalability. Arlo defines an End of Life (EOL) Policy as posted on our EOL Policy page.
What will happen with my device or service?

When a device has been moved into EOL, the following may occur for the EOL'd Arlo Product: 
● No support 
● No firmware upgrades 
● No bug fixes 
● No maintenance releases 
● No workarounds or patches ● No spare parts 
● No replacement devices 
● Bundled services or features may be reduced or eliminated 
● Future services or features may be unavailable 
● Some automatic email alerts and push notifications may be reduced or 
eliminated 
● Offers, discounts, and coupons to purchase newer Arlo products may be given 
● For an Arlo Product that is a service, Arlo customers may be migrated to the 
closest equivalent service or given an offer to change their service plan 
Note: Arlo will provide critical security updates for hardware to one year 
beyond the hardware's EOL date. What devices and services will be moved to EOL? The following Arlo hardware devices will be moved to EOL on July 1, 2023:  
● Arlo Wire-Free Camera (VMC3030) 
● Arlo Pro Camera (VMC4030) 
Note: US customers who onboarded an Arlo Wire-Free Camera (VMC3030) or 
Arlo Pro Camera (VMC4030) before January 1, 2023 are eligible for upgrade 
offers. The following Arlo Hardware devices will be moved to EOL on January 1, 2025: 
● Arlo Pro 2 (VMC4030P) 
● Arlo Q (VMC3040) 
● Arlo Q+ (VMC3040S) 
● Arlo Baby (ABC1000) 
● Arlo Security Lights (ALS1101) 
● Arlo Audio Doorbell (AAD1001) 
The following Arlo Services will be moved to EOL in 2023:  
● Email Notifications for motion and audio detection 
● E911 Emergency Calling

FAQ 
Can I still use my EOL device? EOL devices may continue to be operated by the existing registered Arlo owners to record and 
livestream video from the camera, receive motion notifications on their smartphone, and store video 
clips locally with a compatible Arlo SmartHub or Base Station. EOL devices can utilize Arlo’s new cloud video storage platform, which is available with the Arlo 
Secure subscription service.

However, some features may not be available on EOL devices since 
these devices no longer receive software or firmware updates and are no longer supported.

Does the End of Life Policy apply to all regions? The End of Life Policy for Arlo Services applies to all regions. The End of Life Policy for Arlo 
Hardware applies to all regions except the EU and UK.

Am I able to record videos if I have an Arlo Secure subscription? Yes, users who are subscribed to Arlo Secure can still use their EOL cameras to record video. For 
more information on Arlo Secure, visit: Arlo Secure Plans 
What does this mean to me when E911 Emergency Calling is moved to EOL? E911 Emergency Calling will no longer be available, however, Arlo's Emergency Response feature 
is available for Arlo Secure subscribers. For more information, visit: What is the Arlo Emergency 
Response feature and how does it work?
Why are these services going to EOL?

● Arlo is migrating our emergency response capabilities to new services that 
deliver a full-service, personalized customer experience (Professional 
Monitoring), and a more efficient DIY experience (Direct Dispatch).

● Email system notifications are being retired as push notifications offer a 
superior experience, with better security, privacy, and efficiency. Last Updated:09/24/2024 | Article ID: 000063018 
 
 Are Arlo cameras weatherproof? ● Email system notifications are being retired as push notifications offer a 
superior experience, with better security, privacy, and efficiency. Are Arlo cameras weatherproof? The article about whether Arlo cameras are weatherproof applies to: FLW2001, Arlo_Pro_2, Arlo_Pro_3, Arlo_Pro_3_Floodlight, Arlo_Pro_4, Arlo_Pro_5, Arlo_Pro, AVD4001, AVD3001, AVD2001, AVD1001, VMC5040, VMC2020, VMC2040, VMC2030, VMC2032, VMC3060, VMC2060, VMC3050, VMC2050, VMC3052, VMC2052, VML2030, VML4030. ● Arlo Wired Floodlight Camera 
Note: Arlo cameras and doorbells work in a wide variety of weather conditions, including rain and 
snow, but do NOT allow Arlo batteries or the interior of battery compartments to be exposed to 
water. For more information, visit: 
● Safe Handling and Usage Guidelines for Arlo Rechargeable Batteries  
● Safety Rules for Arlo Non-Rechargeable Batteries  
Recommended Operating Temperature Range for Arlo 
Cameras and Doorbells 
Arlo Ultra series, Arlo Pro series, Arlo Go series, Arlo Essential series, Arlo Audio Doorbell, Arlo 
Video Doorbells, Arlo Wired Floodlight Camera: 
● -4°F to 113°F (-20°C to 45°C) 
Arlo Wire-Free Camera (VMC3030): 
● 14°F to 122°F (-10°C to 50°C) 
Note: Arlo Q, Arlo Q Plus, Arlo Baby, and Arlo Essential Indoor Cameras are designed for INDOOR 
USE ONLY. Outdoor Charging 
Some Arlo cameras can use Arlo Outdoor Charging Cables or Arlo Solar Panels to help keep the 
camera charged outdoors. To purchase outdoor charging accessories, visit: 
Arlo Ultra series, Pro series, and Arlo Go 2 
● Arlo Outdoor Magnetic Charging Cable for Arlo Ultra, Ultra 2, Pro 3, Pro 4, Pro 
5S, Go 2, and Pro 3 Floodlight 
● Arlo Solar Panel for Arlo Ultra, Ultra 2, Pro 3, Pro 4, Pro 5S, Go 2, and Pro 3 
Floodlight Arlo Essential Outdoor series (2nd Generation) 
● Arlo Outdoor Charging Cable for Arlo Essential Outdoor Cameras (2nd 
Generation) 
● Arlo Solar Panel for Arlo Essential Outdoor Cameras (2nd Generation) 
Arlo Essential series 
● Arlo Essential Outdoor Charging Cable for Arlo Essential, Essential Spotlight, 
and Essential XL Spotlight 
● Arlo Solar Panel for Arlo Essential, Essential Spotlight, and Essential XL 
Spotlight 
Arlo Pro, Arlo Pro 2, and Arlo Go 
● Arlo Outdoor Power Adapter for Arlo Pro, Arlo Pro 2, and Arlo Go 
● Arlo Solar Panel for Arlo Pro, Arlo Pro 2, and Arlo Go 
For more information, visit: 
● Arlo Solar Panel Compatibility 
● How can I extend Arlo camera battery life? ● What type of battery does my Arlo camera use? ● How do I keep my Arlo batteries charged in cold weather? ● What do my Arlo camera's battery level icons and notifications mean? We are committed to supporting industry standards for data protection designed to keep your 
personal information private and in your control.

Use the Arlo Privacy Center to manage your 
account, erase cloud recordings, and control your logins and data. To view the Arlo Privacy Center: 
For the Arlo Secure App experience with Feed: 
1. Use the Arlo Privacy Center to manage your 
account, erase cloud recordings, and control your logins and data. Launch the Arlo Secure App.

Tap 
.
Tap Privacy Center.

For the Arlo Secure App experience with Library: 
1. Launch the Arlo Secure App. Launch the Arlo Secure App.
Tap Settings.
Tap Privacy Center.

For the my.arlo.com web portal: 
1. Launch the Arlo Secure App. Log in to my.arlo.com.
Click Settings.

Click Privacy Center or Data Privacy. Use the tabs to navigate and manage your account preferences: 
● Overview: 
Learn about Arlo’s privacy pledge and review our policies. Click Privacy Center or Data Privacy. ● Content: 
Control your content and remove it from the Arlo cloud whenever you want. Use the tabs to navigate and manage your account preferences: 
● Overview: 
Learn about Arlo’s privacy pledge and review our policies. You can 
erase all the content on one or more of your Arlo devices. ● Account: 
See a full list of devices that have access to your Arlo system. You can 
erase all the content on one or more of your Arlo devices. You can log out one 
or more of the devices if someone has unauthorized access.

● Partners: 
View a list of apps and services linked to your Arlo account, like Alexa, Google, or 
IFTTT so you can validate that only authorized apps and services connect to your 
account.

Easily disconnect one or all of the services whenever you need to. Note: Some connections are maintained and controlled by partner services and may need to be 
removed from their website. Easily disconnect one or all of the services whenever you need to. Note: Privacy Center feature availability varies by region. Note: Some connections are maintained and controlled by partner services and may need to be 
removed from their website.

Last Updated:05/03/2024 | Article ID: 000062614 
 
 Where can I find the serial number and firmware version for my Arlo device? Note: Privacy Center feature availability varies by region. Where can I find the serial number 
and firmware version for my Arlo 
device? The article about finding the serial number and firmware version for an Arlo device applies to: AVD4001, AVD3001, AVD2001, AVD1001, AC2001, AAD1001, AC1001, SH1001, MS1001, VMB5000, VMB4540, VMB4500, VMB4000, VMB3500, VMB3000, VMB3010, AL1101, ABB1000, VMC5040, VMC4030P, VMC4040P, FB1001, VMC4041P, VMC4050P, VMC4060P, VMC4030, VMC2020, VMC2040, VMC2030, VMC2032, VMC3060, VMC2060, VMC3050, VMC2050, VMC3052, VMC2052, VML2030, VML4030, VMC3030, VMC3040, VMC3040S, ABC1000. You can find the Arlo device serial number in the Arlo Secure App or on the Arlo device label. The 
firmware version for your Arlo device is located in the Arlo Secure App. To view the serial number and firmware version in the Arlo 
Secure App: 
For the Arlo Secure experience with Feed: 
1. The 
firmware version for your Arlo device is located in the Arlo Secure App. Launch the Arlo Secure App.
Tap Devices.
Select your Arlo device.

Tap 
.

Tap the device name at the top of the Device Settings screen. The Device Info screen displays with Serial Number and Firmware. For the Arlo Secure experience with Library: 
1. The Device Info screen displays with Serial Number and Firmware. Launch the Arlo Secure App.
Tap Settings.
Tap My Devices.
Select your Arlo device.

Tap Device Info. The Device Info screen displays with Serial Number and Firmware. Serial numbers can also be found on the label of the Arlo 
device: 
Arlo SmartHubs and Base Stations 
Serial numbers are on the bottom of the device. The Device Info screen displays with Serial Number and Firmware. Arlo wire-free Cameras, Floodlights, and Security Lights 
Serial numbers are typically in the battery compartment, behind the battery. Arlo wired Cameras 
Serial numbers are typically underneath the camera. Arlo Wired Doorbells 
Serial numbers are on the back of the device, underneath the doorbell mount. Arlo Wire-Free Doorbells 
Serial numbers are behind the battery. Arlo Chimes and Arlo Bridge 
Serial numbers are on the back of the device. Arlo Essential wire-free Cameras 
Serial numbers are on the bottom of the device, underneath the micro-USB charging port cover. Arlo Essential Outdoor Cameras (2nd Generation) 
Serial numbers are on the back of the device. Arlo Essential Indoor Cameras (2nd Generation) 
Serial numbers are on the back of the device, below the micro-USB charging port. Arlo Video Doorbell (2nd Generation) 
Serial numbers are on the back of the device. Arlo Keypad Sensor Hub 
Serial number is on the bottom of the device. If a Cellular and Battery Backup is attached to the Arlo Keypad Sensor Hub, you will need use a 
paperclip to remove the Cellular and Battery Backup to view the serial number. For more information, visit: How do I set up the Arlo Cellular and Battery Backup device?

Arlo All-in-One Sensor 
Serial number is located on the back housing of the sensor. Serial numbers are also listed on the inside of the back housing.

To remove the back housing, visit: How do I replace the battery in the Arlo All-in-One Sensor? Arlo Cellular and Battery Backup 
Serial number is located on the bottom of the device. Last Updated:06/01/2024 | Article ID: 000062026
